src/include/sysdefines.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*! \file sysdefines.h
00002  *  This file defines constants used by system calls.
00003  *
00004  */ 
00005  
00006 #ifndef _SYSDEFINES_H_
00007 #define _SYSDEFINES_H_ 
00008 
00009 /*! Return code when system call returns normally. */
00010 #define ALL_OK                  (0)
00011 /*! Return code when system call returns with an error. */
00012 #define ERROR                   (-1)
00013 /*! Return code when system call is unknown. */
00014 #define ERROR_ILLEGAL_SYSCALL   (-2)
00015 
00016 /*! System call that returns the version of the kernel. */
00017 #define SYSCALL_VERSION         (0)
00018 /*! System call that prints a string. */
00019 #define SYSCALL_PRINTS          (1)
00020 /*! System call that prints a hexadecimal value. */
00021 #define SYSCALL_PRINTHEX        (2)
00022 /*! System call that pauses execution by invoking the bochs debugger. */
00023 #define SYSCALL_DEBUGGER        (3) 
00024 
00025 
00026 /*! System call that terminates the currently running
00027  *  thread. It takes no parameters. Terminates the process
00028  *  when there are no threads left. */
00029 #define SYSCALL_TERMINATE       (4)
00030 
00031 /*! System call that creates a new process with one single
00032  *  thread. It takes an index into the executable table in
00033  *  rdi. The program used is the executable whose index is
00034  *  passed in rdi. */
00035 #define SYSCALL_CREATEPROCESS   (5)
00036 
00037 /*! System call that blocks the calling thread a number of clocks ticks. The
00038    number of clock ticks is passed in rdi. There are 200 clock
00039    ticks per second.*/
00040 #define SYSCALL_PAUSE           (6)
00041 
00042 /*! System call that returns the current system time. The system time is the 
00043     number of clock ticks since system start. There are 200 clock ticks per 
00044     second. */
00045 #define SYSCALL_TIME            (7)
00046 
00047 #endif
